report.summary: Error retrieving parent for item : No resouse fround for Theme.HoloAccent.Light.DarkActionBar
report.label: bug
report.description: When I import this project to my android sdk it gives multiple errors for the RES folder. Can you please help me sort this out?

report.summary: tweets cannot be removed if somehow it has been removed
report.label: bug
report.description: If a tweet shows up in twidere, and it got removed using other twitter clients. This tweet cannot be removed from twidere. An error message saying Error while deleting: This tweet, user or page does not exist will appear on the top of the screen preventing this tweet from deletion.

report.summary: Tab Icons Missing
report.label: bug
report.description: Hello! I noticed my tab icons are missing completely. I have attached images to illustrate what I mean. I'm on a note 4 running 4.4.4. I do not believe I had this issue before the latest update. Thanks! Screenshots:

report.summary: Tweet favourite counter is broken
report.label: bug
report.description: Tweet favourite counter shows always 0, even when someone liked out tweet. We can see correct value on the website, but Twidere shows always 0. version 0.3.0-dev-google, for the time 29.11.2014.

report.summary: No tab icons view v. 0.3.0
report.label: bug
report.description: The top tab icons in the main view are not present, just blank spaces. Thus it is no posible to know what tab you are selecting. Version 0.3.0 in a Samsung i9505 with stock rom. Thanks for your amazing work.

report.summary: Dark theme broken in 0.3.0-dev-fdroid
report.label: bug
report.description: Since I updated to 0.3.0-dev-fdroid the dark theme seems to be broken. If. I want to see my own tweets or any tweets from a specific user the background of the tweets become white while the font color is white too. This makes it impossible to read any tweets.

report.summary: Unread tweet counter doesn't decrement when reading tweets
report.label: bug
report.description: Hello, I was just trying yesterday's commit. I realize that the unread tweet counter does not decrement as I am reading the tweets.

report.summary: Invalid submodule path for DragSortListView
report.label: bug
report.description: Submodule path 'libraries/SlidingMenu': checked out '1fddbfad5b8cf72073e4bdf95a815b0585078fe1' Unable to checkout 'cf66bea00da85aa4c65e62b79918e3e6909e9327' in submodule path 'libraries/DragSortListView'

report.summary: We can't create new posts on GNU social
report.label: bug
report.description: I've just seen you moved the GH project to here. That's a feature the GS users asked you a few months ago, with the last version we can't add our accounts and it's sort of annoying to stay always with an old version. Update: Loging in: https://server.domain/api Basic "No suffix" enabled Deleting the limit characters: Press ##8943373## The problem: Now we're logged in but we can't post new messages, just replies.

report.summary: Actionbar Color in Select Mode
report.label: bug
report.description: It sucks to be stuck in KitKat but look at this..

report.summary: Share from timeline
report.label: bug
report.description: When I press "Share" in the menu of a card in the Home tab, nothing happens. Version: 0.3.0 (dev 2015-03-15)

report.summary: Crash while opening a link in a DM
report.label: bug
report.description: Twidere crash instantly instead of opening the browser.

report.summary: Selecting a trend location: tapping the bullet doesn't work
report.label: bug
report.description: Using commit 72aaf3a - Nexus 5 android 5.1 If I tap the bullet on the list, it doesn't work, I need to tap the text or on the blank space. Here's a little screencast to demonstrate.

report.summary: Sending pictures doesn't work
report.label: bug
report.description: Version : 0.3.0-dev150322 When I try to send a picture, it fails and save the tweet as a draft.

report.summary: The order of the tabs won't change
report.label: bug
report.description: I set an order at the first start-up, but now I can't change it.

report.summary: Some settings don't work anymore
report.label: bug

report.summary: Socks proxy function NOT working in 0.3.0-dev160124
report.label: bug
report.description: Android版本： 5.1.1 Twidere版本：0.3.0-dev160124 现象：登录时无法使用Socks代理登录 步骤： １.初次登陆时在登录界面点击齿轮按钮，进入网络，高级。 ２.选中代理服务器，代理类型为SOCKS，代理服务器主机名为 127.0.0.1 ，端口为 1080 （如下图）。 ３.返回后并尝试登录，提示失败，网络错误。 分析：通过 logcat 查看日志，代理或者解析功能并未通过SOCKS代理，Twidere通过一个被污染的IP地址进行访问。 附件： logcat.txt

report.summary: In network issue,The refresh will freeze,And timeout function has failed
report.label: bug
report.description: Android版本：5.1.1 Twidere版本：0.3.0 (dev 2016-01-24) 连接方式：Twip Twip版本：Mar 30, 2015 Twip模式：O模式 现象： 当遇到可能的网络问题时（网速太慢或者API无响应），Twidere可能会进入刷新卡死状态，无法再次刷新，也无法停止刷新过程，只能强行结束Twidere后再尝试刷新。即使将超时时间缩短为5秒，一样无法解决该问题。 录像： https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3Bh06rrh5m4 Logcat： 当该问题出现时，logcat里没有有效输出。

report.summary: BUG: Tweet not possible - wrong character count
report.label: bug
report.description: Twidere Version 3.1.12 with Twitter for Android API-Keys: I wanted to create a tweet with an Image - first uploaded the Image, wrote the Text - it used 136 chars, 4 are left (says Twidere). Wanted to send it - tweet not possible. Made the same procedure in Twitter Webclient: 180 chars used, 40 over the limit. Deleted the Image, then I had my 136 chars. Somehow Twidere doesn't count the chars needed for the Image. In previous Versions (latest working was IIRC 3.1.9) this was not a problem (Images - the URL - where counted correct, and I could get to the max. 140 chars)

report.summary: BUG: Suddenly login and tabs getting lost.
report.label: bug
report.description: I experienced this on my phone (Moto G 1Gen, Android 5.1): suddenly at starting the program (after a couple of weeks normal working) the twitter login infos, and also some settings (most visible: all tabs) getting lost. It happens with Twidere 3.1.12, but happened also in the last 2-3 previous versions - with both login possibilities. Not all settings are gone: as I use the API-Key of the Twitter-Android client, this key is still there. Funny fact: the same Twidere version with the same Twitter account works parallel on a Android 4.4.2 tablet, and there this"loss" doesn't happen. My workaround now is to import all (previous exported) settings, and login into Twitter again every time this happens.

report.summary: Square profile image setting ignored
report.label: bug

report.summary: Copy Link/Share features copy the retweeted url
report.label: bug
report.description: When I copy the link of a retweeted tweet, Twidere copies the link to the retweet, rather than to the original tweet. Example: The copied link: https://mobile.twitter.com/BillGates/status/852499734728253440 (notice the 'Zaq Retweeted' title on top) Original tweet link: https://mobile.twitter.com/BillGates/status/851768550616420353 (can be obtained by clicking on the tweet's timestamp) This behaviour poses two issues: Usually user wants to share the tweet itself, not the fact that someone retweeted it. I believe this is a far more common use case A far more serious one - if the account of the user who retweeted the tweet is private (followers-only), the shared link becomes useless - you cannot share it with friends, it won't open in the browser. Same private-retweets issue manifests in related features. E.g. 'open in browser' command fails if the user is not logged into twitter in their browser. 'Share' suffers the same issue too. I think it would be a lot more practical if all these features provided the link with the original tweet id, not the retweet id. Android version: 6.0.1 (CM) App version: 3.5.13 Build variant: Google F-Droid Micro-blogging service: Twitter Fanfou GNU Social / StatusNet App settings: Custom API Custom consumer key/secrets Official keys Using Thumbor Connected through proxy Media preview enabled

report.summary: [Bug] Replying to self receives different treatment with mentions
report.label: bug
report.description: First off, a rather meta complaint: Why is reply-to-self handled with a completely different subroutine than other replys in Twidere? I can tell there's separate rules for reply-to-self due to how many issues I have had in the past few months just in that area that didn't affect other replies. There's no reason to treat them differently on the composition end afaik unless Twitter's own API has different areas to send the requests to. The receiving end is different, obviously, since the notifications timeline needs to filter them out. If the composition does indeed require a complete set of separate rules for replying to self, I would enjoy an explanation as to why since it currently makes no sense to me. But anyway, the issue I'm having this time is that I noticed you fixed the removal of users from the list by just removing the @ name in the compose box. However, as of 3.5.16, it doesn't apply this to reply-to-self compositions. In fact, it does the opposite. It actually replies with all users mentioned getting ADDED IN ADDITION TO the list of participants, which means it counts it towards the tweet character limit and will end up duplicating the participants list in Twidere and show the handles within the tweet itself on the official channels. Edited to shorten the rant on the meta issue for the past few bug reports I've filed. I repeat myself a lot, unfortunately, kinda like the meta issue itself. Sorry. 😅

report.summary: "friendica_owner" is not the same like "user"
report.label: bug
report.description: Since some time I noticed that the author of a post was often displayed wrong when working with Friendica. I think the cause is this code: Twidere-Android/twidere.component.common/src/main/java/org/mariotaku/microblog/library/twitter/model/Status.java Line 99 in 0a3a5b1 @JsonField(name = {"user", "friendica_owner"}) The field "friendica_owner" is not the same as the "user" field. The "user" is always the author that should be displayed, while the "friendica_owner" is only of some interest with forum posts. Then it would make sense to show both "user" and "friendica_owner" at the same time. The easiest solution is to not display the "friendica_owner" at all.

report.summary: Off-by-one notification error
report.label: bug
report.description: After a refresh, Twidere shows again and again a notification for the same tweets/toots it has already notified before. On this screenshot, the Android notification is about a mention I've received already, the counter on the icon in Twidere bar is correct (I have no new event indeed, but a notification is displayed anyway). If there are new events, the counter in Twidere bar will be correct (say, 5) but the Android notification will show one more event (6 in this case). The wrongly counted event may be from any account, and sometimes one notification from each account is wrongly counted. So it is an off-by-one error for each account, which may result in several Android notifications wrongly displayed. report.summary: Mastodon and Official API Keys

report.description: Expected behavior When setting an interactions tab to a Mastodon account only, or when there are only mastodon accounts, official twitter API keys should be irrelevant. Actual behavior If an official twitter login is in place, or if the interactions tab is unedited, "activated accounts" will show all activated accounts' notifications. However, if no official twitter login is present and you've changed any setting with the tab, or if you set it to a mastodon account, the option to turn off "Mentions Only" for the tab is grayed out and says "Only available with official keys." Steps to reproduce Log into any Mastodon account. Edit your tabs, and try to set the interactions tab to that account and uncheck "mentions only." Log into a Twitter account with official API keys. Edit the interactions tab again, and set it to all activated accounts and uncheck "mentions only." This will now give full notifications in the tab for both the Twitter and Mastodon accounts. report.summary: pictures in Messages are not preserved if device is flipped

report.description: Expected behavior When sending someone a picture, I will often flip my device to take it, and then flip it back to write the message. I would expect when using the camera to take a picture that the picture is preserved — just as the text is. Actual behavior Pictures are lost. Text is not. Steps to reproduce Messages → $person → Media Button → Camera Take picture in horizontal position, click save. picture is there. Flip phone to portrait position: picture is gone. This also works when selecting a picture from the gallery, but there it's much less critical, only annoying. report.summary: Cannot boost (retweet) public posts from locked Mastodon accounts
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior A public post should be boostable regardless of whether the account is locked. A private (followers-only) post should not be bootable regardless of whether the account is locked. (Account locking on Mastodon just means you have to approve new followers it does not affect post privacy) Actual behavior Public posts from locked Mastodon accounts are treated the same as locked Twitter accounts. A retweet dialog opens and the "retweet" button is grayed out even though the post would be bootable from the web interface. Steps to reproduce Follow a locked Mastodon account, be approved, have that user make a public post, attempt to boost it from twidere. Extra info Android version: 7.1. report.summary: Video fails to unpause after screen off
report.label: bug
report.description: Hi, I just discovered this: was watching a Twitter video, I paused it as someone talked to me, pause was long enough for my screen to turn off (I have a short timeout) and after unlocking the screen, the video was black and I couldn't play it. I couldn't unpause it, nor reload it, neither by tapping the reload button or by going back to the tweet and then tapping to play the video again. Essentially, in this case, screen off during a video killed the video. Hope you can reproduce :) Thanks for making twidere!

report.summary: Mastodon - Answer to a boosted toot not appearing on this toot web page
report.label: bug
report.description: Hi! Thanks for your awesome work on supporting Mastodon! This is a bug I reported on the Mastodon side, but it seems it's actually linked to Twidere behaviour : tootsuite/mastodon#3845 Expected behavior An answer to a boosted (retweeted) toot should be addressed to the original toot, and thus appear on the original toot webpage. Actual behavior When answering a boosted toot, the answer does not appear on the original toot webpage, but instead appears on the boosted toot webpage. Steps to reproduce Answer to a boosted toot, and then select "Open in browser" for this boosted toot. Your answer is there, but this is the booster webpage (check the url) Click on the boosted toot date to access the original toot webpage Your answer is not there. Extra info An example of this behaviour: Here I answered @Ymelia_@witches.town boost of @Hylde_@imaginair.es and my toot appears on her page: https://witches.town/users/Ymelia_/updates/349643 Here is @Hylde_@imaginair.es original toot webpage, where my answer does not appear: https://imaginair.es/users/Hylde_/updates/2245 Android version: 6.0.1 Network type: Cellular Wi-Fi App version: 3.6.21 Build variant: Google F-Droid Micro-blogging service: Twitter Fanfou GNU Social / StatusNet Mastodon App settings: Custom API Custom consumer key/secrets Official keys Using Thumbor Connected through proxy Media preview enabled

Toots that have an image with "Sensitive content" flag on don't necessarily have a 'show more' link (content warning).
